intro: Misandra prorepens, commonly known as the creeping misandra, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are oval-shaped with serrated edges and are arranged alternately along the stem. Misandra prorepens is often grown as a ground cover due to its ability to spread rapidly and its tolerance to various soil conditions.
